result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Court Appointed Attorney Fees in the amount of $602.00 are paid in full from the cash bond and deposits previously paid.  (Attorney Max Saylor in the amount of $203.00 and Attorney Andrew Martinez in the amount of  $399.00)
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: As to Count No. 2 Only

15CM-389 and 15TR-2482 - Both Cases Called @ 3:28 PM: Defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria also present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.   Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.   Def and counsel confirm State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 No DL 3:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 BJump and 15TR-2482 Both DRI.  Argument as to penalty by ADA.  Argument by Atty Martinez for deviation from guidelines - Immigration efforts continue on citizenship.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Def advised he cannot legally drive a motor vehicle. Any further convictions will result in greater penalties being imposed.   Imposes 5 days WCJ, Report 7/1/2016;  Fine and Costs of $750.00 (Inclusive) plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Court imposes all Attorney's Fees for both counsel that were Court Appointed - Fees to paid first prior to other costs.  Hispanic Appeal Rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called @ 3:10 PM: Defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Martinez - in light of immigration issues, counsel requests adjournment of the P/S hrg.  Court adourns P/S.  Atty Martinez will be allowed to appear via telephone for this hearing by agreement of his client.  P/S rescheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Compensation Re:  Court Appointed Counsel Fees - $140.00 - Atty Max Saylor

Case Called @ 3:33 PM: Defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Court questions Def as to status of Court Appointed Counsel.  Notes deposit has not been paid. Def still requests counsel and states he has lost his employment due to inability to drive.  Recently commenced new employment closer to his residence.  Just started one week ago.  Court will require deposit to be paid no later than 12/11/2015 of $250.00.  Once paid Court will appoint counsel.  Def warned deposit must be paid timely.  $50 per mo PP to commence on 1/1/2016.  STC rescheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-01-2015 03:30 pm

15CM-369 and 15TR-2482 - Both Cases Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.   Interpreter oath given by the Court.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Def states he has retained an attorney (Helen - last name unknown) from Green Bay, but the attorney was not able to be here today with him.  Counsel is from the same office as the Marquette Co case (15CT-18) - Antonio or Andrew Martinez is counsel of record in Marquette Co.   Due to Dean Appt in Marquette Co, Court will appoint same counsel - $250 to be paid by 11/20/2015 with a $50 per mo PP to commence on 1/1/2016 - once deposit paid Atty Andrew Martinez will be appointed to represent Def here in Waushara.  Court willing to accomondate any travel concerns of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 11-17-2015 02:45 pm
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

15CM-369 and 15TR-2482 - Both Cases Called @ 3:11 PM: Defendant Miguel A Hernandez-Lara in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karyn Simmons present as Interpreter.  Interpreter oath given by the Court.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves add'l copy of Complaint - Receipt Not Acknowledged by the State.  Court observed the State supplying the Complaint.  Court paraphrases Complaint for Defendant.  Def understands the charges.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Employed - has not tried to retain his own counsel and intends to do so.  Court will proceed with the understanding that he will retain his own counsel.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
